isDisabled.description: Whether the form elements are disabled.
isDisabled.name: isDisabled

isFluid.description: If `true`, the Form will take all available width.
isFluid.name: isFluid

necessityIndicator.description: Whether the required state should be shown as an asterisk or a label, which would display (Optional) on all non required field labels.
necessityIndicator.name: necessityIndicator

size.description: The size of the fields and buttons within the form.
size.name: size

isDisabled.description: Whether the form elements are disabled.
isDisabled.name: isDisabled

isFluid.description: If `true`, the Form will take all available width.
isFluid.name: isFluid

necessityIndicator.description: Whether the required state should be shown as an asterisk or a label, which would display (Optional) on all non required field labels.
necessityIndicator.name: necessityIndicator

size.description: The size of the fields and buttons within the form.
size.name: size

validationBehavior.description:
Whether to use native HTML form validation to prevent form submission
when a field value is missing or invalid, or mark fields as required
or invalid via ARIA.
validationBehavior.name: validationBehavior

validationErrors.description:
Validation errors for the form, typically returned by a server.
This should be set to an object mapping from input names to errors.
validationErrors.name: validationErrors

action.description:
Where to send the form-data when the form is submitted.
See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/form#action).
action.name: action

encType.description:
The enctype attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server.
See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/form#enctype).
encType.name: encType

method.description:
The HTTP method to submit the form with.
See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/form#method).
method.name: method

target.description:
The target attribute specifies a name or a keyword that indicates where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.
See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/form#target).
target.name: target

onSubmit.description: Triggered when a user submits the form.
onSubmit.name: onSubmit

onReset.description: Triggered when a user resets the form.
onReset.name: onReset

onInvalid.description: Triggered for each invalid field when a user submits the form.
onInvalid.name: onInvalid

autoComplete.description:
Indicates whether input elements can by default have their values automatically completed by the browser.
See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/form#autocomplete).
autoComplete.name: autoComplete

autoCapitalize.description:
Controls whether inputted text is automatically capitalized and, if so, in what manner. 
See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/autocapitalize).
autoCapitalize.name: autoCapitalize

role.description: An ARIA role override to apply to the form element.
role.name: role

aria-label.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element.
aria-label.name: aria-label

aria-labelledby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.
aria-labelledby.name: aria-labelledby

aria-describedby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object.
aria-describedby.name: aria-describedby

aria-details.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that provide a detailed, extended description for the object.
aria-details.name: aria-details

isFluid.name: isFluid

necessityIndicator.description: Whether the required state should be shown as an asterisk or a label, which would display (Optional) on all non required field labels.
